definitions.body: Turov: Tyre, famous Phoenician city (Ph. [[חר]]; As. Ṣurru, so TelAm; Egypt. Ḏa-(ï)rạ, Ḏa-ru WMM:As. u. Eur. 185);—[[חׂר]] 2Sa 24:7 + 32 t., [[חוֹר]] 1Ki 5:15 + 8 t. (Gi);—city of Hiram, friend of David and Sol. 2Sa 5:11, 1Ki 5:15, 1Ki 9:11, 1Ki 9:12, 1Ch 14:1, 2Ch 2:2, 2Ch 2:10; of artif. Hiram 1Ki 7:13; [[בַּת־חׂר]] Ps 45:13 of city personif. (another view in Che); ´[[ח]] also in name of Ph. fotress, ´[[מִבְחַר־ח]] 2Sa 24:7, ´[[ח]] ´[[עִיר מ]] Jos 19:29 (P); threatened by proph. Am 1:9, Am 1:10 and (with esp. ref. to commercial greatness) Is 23:1 ([[מַשָׂא חׂר]]), v:Is 23:5, v:Is 23:8, v:Is 23:15, v:Is 23:15, v:Is 23:17, Je 25:22 ([[מַלְכֵי־חׂר]]), Je 27:3 ([[מֶלֶח חׂר]]), Je 47:4, Ez Eze 26:2, Eze 26:3, Eze 26:4, Eze 26:7, Eze 26:15, Eze 27:2, Eze 27:3, Eze 27:3, Eze 27:8, Eze 27:32, Eze 28:2 ([[נְגִיד חׂר]]), v:Eze 28:12 ([[מֶלֶח חוֹר]]); besieged by Nebuch. Eze 29:18, Eze 29:18; cf. Zec 9:2; Zec 29:3, Joe 4:4, Ps 83:8 (´[[ישְׁבֵי ח]]); of Tyrians as proselytes Ps 87:4 (predict.);—[[לְחוֹר]] Ho 9:13 is prob. corrupt, read [[לָחוֹד]] or [[לָחַיִד]] LXX We GASm, cf. Now.—´[[ח]] oft. + [[חִידוֹן]] q.v.;—see, on Tyre, Pietschm:Phön. 60 ff. Rob:BR ii. 461 ff. de Luynes:Voyage à la Mer Morte (1874) i. 28 ff., and Pl xiii – xviii Bd:Pal. 3 (1898), 307 ff: —
